a diverse education through a culture of life-long learning.

div.div: Partly sunny, with a high near 65. Breezy, with a north northwest wind 21 to 24 mph, with gusts as high as 38 mph.
Mostly clear, with a low around 40. Breezy, with a north northwest wind 15 to 20 mph becoming light northwest after midnight. Winds could gust as high as 31 mph.
Sunny, with a high near 75. Northwest wind 5 to 7 mph becoming calm in the morning.

span.font: Fred Rogers Productions will post a new activity, recipe or craft each day on multiple social media sites. Click on the above link to learn more and to access lots of virtual events, activities, and other social initiatives shared online!

p.span: Elementary packets for the remaining weeks of the school year will be hand delivered to homes on Thursday, April 30 If that time does not work,

a.aria-label: Read more about Elementary Packet Delivery

span.span: Secondary students and their parents/guardians are encouraged to sign up for the NAVIGATE 2020 Virtual Conference and College Fair. This FREE event includes three days of live-stream expert presentations, informative sessions about the college decision process, and a virtual college fair with fully interactive booths. Students can also chat live with college admissions representatives from across the country.
It is never too early (or too late) to explore options!
Click on this link for more information or to register:

a.aria-label: Read more about NAVIGATE 2020 Virtual Conference & College Fair

p.span: Click here to view or print the PDF document

h3.a: From the Ms. Hottovy, School Counselor

p.span: Earlier today (April 20) students who are current 8th, 9th, 10th, and 11th graders received information via email from Ms. Amy Hottovy, FPS school counselor, about registering for next year's classes. Those students and their parents/guardians are encouraged to talk over the information before Ms. Hottovy meets with classes next week to start the registration process. We encourage students to reach out with any questions and to challenge themselves by taking classes next year that set them up for future success!

a.aria-label: Read more about From the Ms. Hottovy, School Counselor
Read more about One Week of Wellness

span.span: Some great ideas to keep bodies and minds active whilst lifting community spirit! This site includes activities for various age groups, as well as individual and family activities! There are several ideas that touch on Easter, but could easily be adapted for Spring, Earth Day, Arbor Day, Cinco de Mayo or Mother's Day!
I hope that you are all inspired to participate...post some pics and
tag Friend Public School so we can all enjoy!

a.aria-label: Read more about Community Spirit Activities
